title: Authors and Citation
text: Buongiorno S (2025). usdoj: Accessing U.S. Department Justice (DOJ) Open Data. R package version 1.1.2, https://github.com/ropengov/usdoj.
code: @Manual{,   title = {usdoj: For Accessing U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) Open Data},   author = {Steph Buongiorno},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.1.2},   url = {https://github.com/ropengov/usdoj}, }

what: For Accessing U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) Open Data
title: For Accessing U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) Open Data
text: usdoj fetches blog entries press releases United States Department Justice API. Optional parameters let users choose many results return, whether start earliest latest publications, whether include results contain specific keywords. Data cleaned structured analysis returned dataframe.

title: For Accessing U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) Open Data
code: install.packages("usdoj") # Enable repository from ropengov options(repos = c(   ropengov = 'https://ropengov.r-universe.dev',   CRAN = 'https://cloud.r-project.org'))  # Download and install usdoj install.packages("usdoj")

title: For Accessing U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) Open Data
text: doj_press_releases() returns dataframe following fields: body: text body press release changed: Date data changed created: Date data created date: Date press release content teaser: blurb press release title: title press release url: URL original press release relating Attorney’s Office hosted U.S. DOJ uuid: universal unique identifier single result vuuid: universal unique identifier specific version single result name: related office(s) doj_blog_entries() returns dataframe following fields: body: text body blog entry changed: Date data changed created: Date data created date: Date press release content teaser: blurb blog entry title: title blog entry url: URL original blog release “Justice Blogs,” U.S. DOJ uuid: universal unique identifier single result vuuid: universal unique identifier specific version single result name: related office(s)

title: For Accessing U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) Open Data
text: Load usdoj. Return dataframe 50 latest recorded blog entries recorded. Data cleaned. Return dataframe 10 latest recorded press releases. Data cleaned. Return dataframe 50 latest recorded blog entries body text includes keyword(s).
code: library(usdoj) doj_blog_entries() doj_press_releases(n_results = 10, search_direction = "DESC", clean = FALSE) doj_blog_entries(keyword = c("weapons", "firearms"))

title: For Accessing U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) Open Data
text: Please cite package follows: Buongiorno S (2023). usdoj: Accessing U.S. Department Justice (DOJ) Open Data. https://github.com/stephbuon/usdoj, https://ropengov.github.io/usdoj/, https://github.com/rOpenGov/usdoj. BibTeX: See website projects. Note usdoj manages request rate limits compliance Department Justice API. Disclaimer package officially related endorsed U.S. Department Justice.
code: @Manual{,   title = {usdoj: For Accessing U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) Open Data},   author = {Steph Buongiorno},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/stephbuon/usdoj, https://ropengov.github.io/usdoj/, https://github.com/rOpenGov/usdoj}, }

title: Retrieve DOJ Blog Entries — doj_blog_entries
text: function retrieves blog entries U.S. Department Justice API. can specify number results, sort direction, optional keyword filter.

title: Retrieve DOJ Blog Entries — doj_blog_entries
code: doj_blog_entries(   n_results = 50,   search_direction = "DESC",   keyword = NULL,   clean = TRUE )

title: Retrieve DOJ Blog Entries — doj_blog_entries
text: n_results Integer. Number blog entries retrieve. Default 50. search_direction Character. Sort order: either "ASC" (oldest first) "DESC" (newest first). Default "DESC". keyword Optional character string filter results keyword. clean Logical. TRUE, cleans blog body teaser fields. Default TRUE.

title: Retrieve DOJ Blog Entries — doj_blog_entries
text: cleaned dataframe containing DOJ blog entry metadata content.

title: Retrieve DOJ Blog Entries — doj_blog_entries
code: # \dontrun{ # Retrieve a single DOJ blog entry result <- doj_blog_entries(n_results = 1) #> Warning: There were 2 warnings in `mutate()`. #> The first warning was: #> ℹ In argument: `created = anydate(as.numeric(created))`. #> Caused by warning in `anydate()`: #> ! NAs introduced by coercion #> ℹ Run `dplyr::last_dplyr_warnings()` to see the 1 remaining warning. print(result) #>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          body #> 1 On December 17, ICITAP’s Global Forensic Science Unit provided an update on the impact of its assistance to Costa Rica’s Judicial Investigations Organization (OIJ) Department of Forensic Sciences (DFS). In December 2024, scientists from the Costa Rica’s DFS published an article entitled “A practical approach to mitigating cognitive bias effects in forensic casework” in the Forensic Science International: Synergy journal. The Synergy journal is an international open access journal showcasing the most cutting-edge interdisciplinary research and policy and management analysis in forensic science. The article focuses on the practical implementation of training, linear sequential unmasking, and blind proficiency testing strategies for mitigating bias and results that were demonstrated by the DFS’ Questioned Documents section, and serves as a foundation for expanding those strategies to full-scale implementation. Although recent research has raised awareness of human factors in forensic science, very few laboratories have successfully implemented significant countermeasures to mitigate bias in their procedures. The development of this pilot plan was supported by a study tour facilitated by ICITAP to allow members of the DFS to visit US laboratories that are leading the field in this area, including in-depth discussions with executive leadership and observation of how mitigating protocols are applied in day-to-day operations and integrated into organizational culture. This article is the DFS’ second publication in Synergy, where they previously published an article about their successful implementation and results of ICITAP-supported Lean Six Sigma training. The OIJ DFS is an accredited laboratory that serves as a regional role model for Central America and has consistently demonstrated their dedication to improving their service as a forensic provider through projects focused on efficiency and program management. ICITAP works in Central America in partnership with the U.S. Department of State’s Bureau of International Narcotic and Law Enforcement Affairs (INL). #>   changed created       date #> 1    <NA>    <NA> 2024-12-17 #>                                                                                                                                                                                                             teaser #> 1 On December 17, ICITAP’s Global Forensic Science Unit provided an update on the impact of its assistance to Costa Rica’s Judicial Investigations Organization (OIJ) Department of Forensic Sciences (DFS).  #>                                                                                                                  title #> 1 Costa Rica: Department of Forensic Sciences Publishes Scientific Article on Mitigating Bias in Forensic Laboratories #>                                                                                                                                                   url #> 1 https://www.justice.gov/archives/criminal/criminal-icitap/blog/costa-rica-department-forensic-sciences-publishes-scientific-article-mitigating-bias #>                                   uuid name #> 1 d06fc5ec-7735-4742-b29e-b4fd84f400e9 <NA> # }

title: Retrieve DOJ Press Releases — doj_press_releases
text: function retrieves press releases U.S. Department Justice API. can specify number results, search direction, optional keyword filtering.

title: Retrieve DOJ Press Releases — doj_press_releases
code: doj_press_releases(   n_results = 50,   search_direction = "DESC",   keyword = NULL,   clean = TRUE )

title: Retrieve DOJ Press Releases — doj_press_releases
text: n_results Integer. Number press releases retrieve. Default 50. search_direction Character. "ASC" "DESC" ascending descending sort date. Default "DESC". keyword Optional character string filter results keyword. clean Logical. TRUE, cleans text fields. Default TRUE.

title: Retrieve DOJ Press Releases — doj_press_releases
text: cleaned dataframe containing DOJ press release metadata content.

title: Retrieve DOJ Press Releases — doj_press_releases
code: # \dontrun{ # Retrieve a single DOJ press release result <- doj_press_releases(n_results = 1) #> Warning: There were 2 warnings in `mutate()`. #> The first warning was: #> ℹ In argument: `created = anydate(as.numeric(created))`. #> Caused by warning in `anydate()`: #> ! NAs introduced by coercion #> ℹ Run `dplyr::last_dplyr_warnings()` to see the 1 remaining warning. print(result) #>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       body #> 1 ATLANTA - Attorney General Pamela Bondi has appointed Theodore S. Hertzberg as Interim United States Attorney for the Northern District of Georgia pursuant to 28 U.S.C. § 546, which provides that “the Attorney General may appoint a United States [A]ttorney for the district in which the office of United States [A]ttorney is vacant.” This appointment took effect on May 13, 2025. Chief U.S. District Judge Timothy C. Batten, Sr. administered Mr. Hertzberg’s oath of office on May 14, 2025.Mr. Hertzberg previously served as an Assistant U.S. Attorney for nearly ten years. His tenure with the Justice Department began in the Savannah headquarters of the U.S. Attorney’s Office for the Southern District of Georgia. In Savannah, Mr. Hertzberg prosecuted violent criminals, drug dealers, fraudsters, and money launderers while also serving as chief of the asset forfeiture section. Upon relocating to Atlanta in 2018, Mr. Hertzberg transferred to the U.S. Attorney’s Office for the Northern District of Georgia, where he prosecuted gang leaders, child sex predators, gun traffickers, armed felons, and other dangerous offenders.Before joining the Department of Justice, Mr. Hertzberg practiced law in the New York office of Kramer Levin Naftalis & Frankel LLP, and he served as a law clerk to the Honorable Kristi K. DuBose of the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of Alabama.U.S. Attorney Hertzberg is a graduate of Amherst College and New York University School of Law.For further information please contact the U.S. Attorney’s Public Affairs Office at USAGAN.PressEmails@usdoj.gov or (404) 581-6280. The Internet address for the U.S. Attorney’s Office for the Northern District of Georgia is http://www.justice.gov/usao-ndga. #>   changed created       date number #> 1    <NA>    <NA> 2025-05-14   <NA> #>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            teaser #> 1 Attorney General Pamela Bondi has appointed Theodore S. Hertzberg as Interim United States Attorney for the Northern District of Georgia pursuant to 28 U.S.C. § 546, which provides that “the Attorney General may appoint a United States [A]ttorney for the district in which the office of United States [A]ttorney is vacant.” This appointment took effect on May 13, 2025. Chief U.S. District Judge Timothy C. Batten, Sr. administered Mr. Hertzberg’s oath of office on May 14, 2025. #>                                                                                                              title #> 1 Attorney General Pamela Bondi Appoints Career Prosecutor Theodore S. Hertzberg as Interim United States Attorney #>                                                                                                                          url #> 1 https://www.justice.gov/usao-ndga/pr/attorney-general-pamela-bondi-appoints-career-prosecutor-theodore-s-hertzberg-interim #>                                   uuid                     name #> 1 41713eb3-b83c-4329-a80a-6e898bbd6d2c USAO - Georgia, Northern # }
